events.message: Customer reported a car accident involving a rear-end collision on the highway during rush hour.
Claim was reviewed and assigned to the 'Auto Accident' category for further processing.
An insurance agent was assigned to the claim to handle customer communications and next steps.
The customer received confirmation that their claim has been logged and the process has begun.
Request sent to customer for accident photos, police report, and vehicle repair estimate documents.
Customer submitted all requested documents including detailed photos and official police report.
Insurance company began an investigation to assess the validity and extent of the claimed damages.
Investigation confirmed the damages and verified that the claim adheres to policy terms.
A settlement offer was prepared and sent to the customer covering the repair costs of the vehicle.
Customer responded positively to the settlement proposal, expressing satisfaction with the offer.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance company based on the investigation report.
Payment for the approved claim amount was issued and transferred to the customerâ€™s account.
The claim process was successfully completed and officially closed with customer satisfaction.
All records and documents related to the claim were archived for future reference and compliance.
